title: Code of Conduct
text: project follows Contributor Covenant Code Conduct. https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct/ Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported maintainers temuulen@gmail.com.

title: Contributing to mongolstats
text: Thanks interest contributing! project welcomes issues, ideas, pull requests.

title: Contributing to mongolstats
text: Requires R (>= 4.1). Recommended: RStudio vignette building (bundles Pandoc). Install dependencies go; smoke/test scripts handle .

title: Contributing to mongolstats
text: Rscript tools/smoke.R Rscript -e "invisible(lapply(list.files('R', full.names=TRUE), source)); library(testthat); test_dir('tests/testthat', reporter='summary')" Rscript tools/build_site.R

title: Contributing to mongolstats
text: Keep changes focused tidyverse-styled. Add tests new behavior feasible. Update README vignettes user-facing behavior changes.

title: Contributing to mongolstats
text: participating, agree abide Code Conduct CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md.

title: Batch fetching workflows
code: reqs <- list(   list(tbl_id = "DT_NSO_0300_001V2", selections = list(Sex = "Total", Age = "Total", Year = "2024")),   list(tbl_id = "DT_NSO_0300_004V5", selections = list(Year = "2024")) ) reqs ## [[1]] ## [[1]]$tbl_id ## [1] "DT_NSO_0300_001V2" ##  ## [[1]]$selections ## [[1]]$selections$Sex ## [1] "Total" ##  ## [[1]]$selections$Age ## [1] "Total" ##  ## [[1]]$selections$Year ## [1] "2024" ##  ##  ##  ## [[2]] ## [[2]]$tbl_id ## [1] "DT_NSO_0300_004V5" ##  ## [[2]]$selections ## [[2]]$selections$Year ## [1] "2024"

title: Batch fetching workflows
code: pkg <- nso_package(reqs, labels = "en") pkg %>% dplyr::slice_head(n = 10) ## # A tibble: 0 × 0

title: Batch fetching workflows
code: itms <- nso_tables() target <- itms %>% dplyr::filter(stringr::str_detect(stringr::str_to_lower(tbl_eng_nm), "population")) %>% dplyr::slice_head(n = 5) target %>% dplyr::select(tbl_id, tbl_eng_nm) ## # A tibble: 5 × 2 ##   tbl_id             tbl_eng_nm                                                  ##   <chr>              <chr>                                                       ## 1 DT_NSO_2100_012V1  NEW CASES OF CANCER, per 10000 population, by type of canc… ## 2 DT_NSO_2100_013V1  DEATHS OF CANCER, per 10000 population, by type of cancer   ## 3 DT_NSO_2100_045V1  NEW CASES AND MORTALITY OF CANCER PER 10 000 POPULATION, b… ## 4 DT_NSO_0300_071V02 INPATIENTS PER 10000 POPULATION, 10 leading classification… ## 5 DT_NSO_0100_01T39  NUMBER OF WORKING AGED POPULATION, by year

title: Discovering tables and variables
code: itms <- nso_itms() itms %>% dplyr::select(tbl_id, tbl_eng_nm, strt_prd, end_prd) %>% dplyr::slice_head(n = 10) ## # A tibble: 10 × 4 ##    tbl_id             tbl_eng_nm                                strt_prd end_prd ##    <chr>              <chr>                                     <chr>    <chr>   ##  1 DT_NSO_0100_001V10 BALANCE OF PAYMENTS, by month             NA       NA      ##  2 DT_NSO_0300_010V5  WEEKLY PRICES OF MAIN PRODUCTS AND GASOL… 2025-09… 2024-0… ##  3 DT_NSO_0303_07V7   CONSUMER PRICE INDEX IN AIMAGS, compared… 2015=100 2023=1… ##  4 DT_NSO_0303_07V8   CONSUMER PRICE INDEX IN AIMAGS, compared… 2015=100 2023=1… ##  5 DT_NSO_0303_07V9   CONSUMER PRICE INDEX IN AIMAGS, compared… 2015=100 2023=1… ##  6 DT_NSO_0600_001V3  NATIONAL BASE CONSUMER PRICE INDEX, by g… 2015=100 2023=1… ##  7 DT_NSO_0600_001V4  WEEKLY PRICES OF MAIN PRODUCTS AND GASOL… 2025-09… 2021-0… ##  8 DT_NSO_0600_002V1  NATIONAL CONSUMER PRICE INDEX, 1991-1-16… 2024     1991    ##  9 DT_NSO_0600_002V21 CONSUMER PRICE INDEX, by group, compared… 2015=100 2023=1… ## 10 DT_NSO_0600_002V22 CONSUMER PRICE INDEX, by group, compared… 2015=100 2023=1…

title: Discovering tables and variables
code: vars <- nso_variables("DT_NSO_0300_001V2") vars %>% dplyr::count(field) ## # A tibble: 3 × 2 ##   field     n ##   <chr> <int> ## 1 Age      88 ## 2 Sex       3 ## 3 Year     25 vars %>% dplyr::slice_head(n = 10) ## # A tibble: 10 × 6 ##    field itm_id scr_eng scr_mn px_path                                   px_file ##    <chr> <chr>  <chr>   <chr>  <chr>                                     <chr>   ##  1 Sex   0      Total   NA     Population, household/1_Population, hous… DT_NSO… ##  2 Sex   1      Male    NA     Population, household/1_Population, hous… DT_NSO… ##  3 Sex   2      Female  NA     Population, household/1_Population, hous… DT_NSO… ##  4 Age   0      Total   NA     Population, household/1_Population, hous… DT_NSO… ##  5 Age   1      0       NA     Population, household/1_Population, hous… DT_NSO… ##  6 Age   2      1       NA     Population, household/1_Population, hous… DT_NSO… ##  7 Age   3      2       NA     Population, household/1_Population, hous… DT_NSO… ##  8 Age   4      3       NA     Population, household/1_Population, hous… DT_NSO… ##  9 Age   5      4       NA     Population, household/1_Population, hous… DT_NSO… ## 10 Age   6      5       NA     Population, household/1_Population, hous… DT_NSO…

title: Fetching data and working with periods
Fetching data and working with periods

what: Fetch data by period and variables
title: Fetching data and working with periods
code: dat <- nso_data(   tbl_id = "DT_NSO_0300_001V2",   selections = list(Sex = "Total", Age = "Total", Year = head(periods, 1)),   labels = "en" ) ## Error: HTTP 400 Bad Request. dat %>% dplyr::slice_head(n = 6) ## Error: object 'dat' not found

title: Getting started with mongolstats
code: itms <- nso_itms() itms %>% dplyr::select(dplyr::any_of(c("tbl_id", "tbl_eng_nm", "strt_prd", "end_prd"))) %>% dplyr::slice_head(n = 5) ## # A tibble: 5 × 4 ##   tbl_id             tbl_eng_nm                                 strt_prd end_prd ##   <chr>              <chr>                                      <chr>    <chr>   ## 1 DT_NSO_0100_001V10 BALANCE OF PAYMENTS, by month              NA       NA      ## 2 DT_NSO_0300_010V5  WEEKLY PRICES OF MAIN PRODUCTS AND GASOLI… 2025-09… 2024-0… ## 3 DT_NSO_0303_07V7   CONSUMER PRICE INDEX IN AIMAGS, compared … 2015=100 2023=1… ## 4 DT_NSO_0303_07V8   CONSUMER PRICE INDEX IN AIMAGS, compared … 2015=100 2023=1… ## 5 DT_NSO_0303_07V9   CONSUMER PRICE INDEX IN AIMAGS, compared … 2015=100 2023=1…

title: Getting started with mongolstats
code: vars <- nso_variables("DT_NSO_0300_001V2") vars %>% dplyr::count(field) ## # A tibble: 3 × 2 ##   field     n ##   <chr> <int> ## 1 Age      88 ## 2 Sex       3 ## 3 Year     25 vars %>% dplyr::filter(field %in% c("Sex","Age","Year")) %>% dplyr::slice_head(n = 10) ## # A tibble: 10 × 6 ##    field itm_id scr_eng scr_mn px_path                                   px_file ##    <chr> <chr>  <chr>   <chr>  <chr>                                     <chr>   ##  1 Sex   0      Total   NA     Population, household/1_Population, hous… DT_NSO… ##  2 Sex   1      Male    NA     Population, household/1_Population, hous… DT_NSO… ##  3 Sex   2      Female  NA     Population, household/1_Population, hous… DT_NSO… ##  4 Age   0      Total   NA     Population, household/1_Population, hous… DT_NSO… ##  5 Age   1      0       NA     Population, household/1_Population, hous… DT_NSO… ##  6 Age   2      1       NA     Population, household/1_Population, hous… DT_NSO… ##  7 Age   3      2       NA     Population, household/1_Population, hous… DT_NSO… ##  8 Age   4      3       NA     Population, household/1_Population, hous… DT_NSO… ##  9 Age   5      4       NA     Population, household/1_Population, hous… DT_NSO… ## 10 Age   6      5       NA     Population, household/1_Population, hous… DT_NSO…

title: Getting started with mongolstats
code: dat <- nso_data(   tbl_id = "DT_NSO_0300_001V2",   selections = list(Sex = "Total", Age = "Total", Year = "2024") ) ## Error: HTTP 400 Bad Request. dat %>% dplyr::slice_head(n = 6) ## Error: object 'dat' not found

title: Authors and Citation
text: Enebish T (2025). Mongolian NSO PXWeb Data Boundaries (Tidy Client). R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://temuulene.github.io/mongolstats/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {Mongolian NSO PXWeb Data and Boundaries (Tidy Client)},   author = {Temuulen Enebish},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://temuulene.github.io/mongolstats/}, }

title: mongolstats
text: Tidy access National Statistics Office Mongolia (NSO) statistics via PXWeb API (data.1212.mn) Mongolia administrative boundaries, inspired ergonomics tidycensus. Provides tidyverse-friendly interface discovering tables, exploring codebooks, fetching data, working sf geometries mapping.

title: mongolstats
code: library(mongolstats) library(dplyr)  # Use new PXWeb API (data.1212.mn) nso_options(mongolstats.lang = "en")  # List available tables itms <- nso_itms() itms %>% select(tbl_id, tbl_eng_nm, strt_prd, end_prd) %>% slice_head(n = 5)  # Inspect variables (codebook) for a table vars <- nso_variables("DT_NSO_0300_001V2") vars %>% count(field)  # Fetch data dat <- nso_data(   tbl_id = "DT_NSO_0300_001V2",   selections = list(Sex = "Total", Age = "Total", Year = "2024") ) dat %>% slice_head(n = 6)

title: mongolstats
text: PXWeb client NSO data (data.1212.mn) Discover tables variables nso_itms() / nso_itms_detail() Fetch data via nso_data(tbl_id, selections=...); batch nso_package() Optional label columns English Mongolian (labels = "en" | "mn" | "") Category navigation table search helpers Mongolia administrative boundaries (ADM0–ADM2) sf Exact fuzzy name-based boundary joins Lightweight -disk caching faster table/codebook lookups

title: mongolstats
text: Getting started Discovering tables variables Fetching data periods Batch fetching workflows Mapping, fuzzy joins, code-based joins

Mongolia administrative boundaries (sf) — mn_boundaries
text: Downloads Mongolia boundaries ADM0/ADM1/ADM2 GeoBoundaries API returns sf object. Results can cached caller needed.

Add normalized name columns to boundaries — mn_boundaries_normalize
Add normalized name columns to boundaries — mn_boundaries_normalize
text: g sf object mn_boundaries() name_col Column English names (default 'shapeName').

title: Add normalized name columns to boundaries — mn_boundaries_normalize
Boundary keys/crosswalk helper — mn_boundary_keys
text: tibble key columns GeoBoundaries normalized names.

Fuzzy join data to boundaries by name — mn_fuzzy_join_by_name
code: mn_fuzzy_join_by_name(   data,   name_col,   level = "ADM1",   boundaries = NULL,   max_distance = 2,   method = c("osa", "lv", "jw", "dl") )

title: Fuzzy join data to boundaries by name — mn_fuzzy_join_by_name
text: data Data frame name column. name_col Column data containing names. level Boundary level. boundaries Optional pre-fetched boundaries. max_distance Maximum string distance match (default 2). method Distance method passed stringdist::stringdist.

title: Fuzzy join data to boundaries by name — mn_fuzzy_join_by_name

Join data to boundaries by (normalized) names — mn_join_by_name
text: data Data frame name column. name_col Column data contains names join . level Boundary level, passed mn_boundaries() boundaries provided. boundaries Optional pre-fetched boundaries.

title: Join data to boundaries by (normalized) names — mn_join_by_name
Enable or configure caching — nso_cache_enable
text: Caches table lists codebooks disk speed repeated calls.

title: Enable or configure caching — nso_cache_enable
text: dir Directory cache; defaults user cache dir.

text: tbl_id Table identifier (e.g., "DT_NSO_0300_001V2"). selections Named list mapping variable labels (e.g., Year, Sex) desired codes labels. labels Label handling: "none" (codes ), "en", "mn", "".

title: Create period codes — nso_period_seq
text: Utilities construct NSO period codes sequences. monthly data, use YYYYMM; yearly, use YYYY.

title: Create period codes — nso_period_seq
text: start, end Start end periods character (YYYY YYYYMM). 'Y' yearly 'M' monthly.

mongolstats 0.0.0.9000
text: Initial development snapshot. NSO API wrappers: nso_itms(), nso_itms_detail(), nso_data(), nso_package() Sector helpers: nso_sectors(), nso_subsectors(), nso_search() Boundaries: mn_boundaries(), join helpers incl. fuzzy joins Caching discovery endpoints Vignettes getting started, mapping, fuzzy joins, code-based joins
